metadata.synopsis: Covers the interactions with the mirror of loss in the Darkmoon Cloister. Allows players to offer memories in return for a chance to roll on a chance to be given stat improving memories.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Talk to the mirror of lossr in the grotto

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *The huge mirror stares down at you like a great, dark eye.*

81.speaker: Shadowheart
81.text: This feels familiar to me, somehow. I'm sure I've stood before this mirror before... many times, perhaps.
81.context: NodeContext: Unsettled sense of recognition/hairs standing on the back of your neck. (this mirror is what was used to take Shadowheart's memories from her)

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Gaze into the mirror, intent on offering it one of your memories.

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *Your mind still reels from what you have already received from the mirror. You cannot partake again.*

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *You feel your goddess' presence once again. As her Chosen, you have already made the ultimate offering.*

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *Now, all you need to do is claim a reward.*

105.speaker: Narrator
105.text: *With so much of your mind already surrendered to the mirror, you have nothing to offer. A sorry outcome.*

94.speaker: Narrator
94.text: *The mirror has already leached away all it desires from you. Your mind is but an empty cup.*

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *The mirror's emptiness seems to draw your into a stupefying embrace. Your thoughts, feelings, memories - they grow slow and drowsy, drifting away from each other.*

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *You must surrender some part of yourself. But what?*

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Part with the forbidden knowledge from the Thayan Tome.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Offer memories of your strength - times when you triumphed, thanks to your raw power.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Give up memories of your youth, when your heart was carefree and your limbs were nimble.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Relinquish memories of fortitude and well-being, when body and mind held fast against all challenges.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Surrender valued knowledge gleaned from books, scrolls, tablets... words that left a mark on your mind - but no more.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Let go of some wisdoms that time has bestowed upon you - old wounds, tough lessons, and fond memories alike.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Give away memories of when your charm stood to you - the applause of the swayed, the smiles of the beguiled, the kisses of the seduced.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Rediscovering your long-lost friend bolstered your very being - surrender that feeling.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Part with memories of blooming romance, when your heart was full and smile came readily.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: You learned much from Allister Marnley, your old teacher. Now part with his lessons.

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *Something precious was surrendered. Already, you cannot recall its exact nature - but you feel its loss, all the same.*

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *You feel parts of your own being take flight from you. Is this what Shadowheart experienced, when she surrendered her memories...?*

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *The gaps in your mind grow wider as you allow yourself to be diminished.*

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *Still though, for whatever was lost, something new shall be gained...*

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *You feel the presence of something, ancient and unknowable. It has taken notice of you.*

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *The spilled blood of Selûne's daughter comes to your mind. You are a favoured servant. A Dark Justiciar.*

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your craven heart.*

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your false heart.*

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your jealous heart.*

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your prying heart.*

27.speaker: Narrator
27.text: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your yearning heart.*

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *You are helpless as it explores your very being. It knows the secrets of your violent heart.*

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *Where once the mirror showed nothing, there is now something. Memories, experiences, skills - your own. Surrendered once, and now offered back to you to choose from.*

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Claim the strength found in a spirit who has had to fight for her place in the world.

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *Day after day, the bullies would await you. But you would not give in. Whatever they did, you would return in kind, blow for blow. Your knuckles ached. Your lip bled. But you stood tall.*

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Steal the deft-handed prowess of someone trained in stealth all her life.

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *First you took apples from stalls, then gold from purses. Once, you even lifted a necklace right off a matron's throat. The other novices were in awe of you.*

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Seize the fortitude that lies in a heart denied a thousand times.

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *The Mother Superior shook her head. You were not yet ready. But you would persist. You would try harder. One day, you would become a Dark Justiciar.*

115.speaker: Narrator
115.text: *The memory fades away, yet you feel its influence linger in your body.*

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Adopt the curiosity of a young child who hungered for knowledge forbidden to her.

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *You devoured any book you could get your hands on, hungry for more. Sometimes you felt like you read the same thing over and over, yet the knowledge within always seemed new...*

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *The memory fades away, yet it leaves its mark on your mind.*

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *The dark mirror seems to turn dormant, its hunger sated.*

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Absorb the wisdom of a novice who weathered harsh lessons and harsher punishments.

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *The sting of the rod washes over you, again and again. Like some cruel, endless tide. But you shall not cry out, or let tears bead your eyes. You shall persevere.*

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Embrace the cunning of a youth who learned to succeed through charm and deceit.

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *A small miracle - the Mother Superior believed your lie. Or does she...? There is a bright gleam in her eye. Appreciation, perhaps? Respect?*

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *Where once the mirror showed nothing, there is now something. Memories, experiences, skills. All prised from the minds of others, and now offered to you, to choose from.*

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Claim memories of strength from a long-dead general, who marched under the banner of a vanished kingdom.

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *On either side, your ranks start to buckle under the enemy onslaught. You unleash a battle cry and push back, rallying the troops.*

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Help yourself to the memories of a seasoned thief's most daring exploits.

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *You escape across the rooftops of Baldur's Gate with the sure-footedness of a cat. The jingle of stolen gold and the fading cries of the City Watch are music to your ears.*

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Seize the memories of a barbarian, whose mind and body were tempered against hardship.

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *The cold bites, but you laugh and bare your chest. Be it blade, beast, or the elements - nothing daunts you.*

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Glean the secrets of a wizard who once stalked the library of Candlekeep.

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *Words and symbols flurry past. Years of reading by candlelight dulled your eyesight, but sharpened your mind. Your knowledge lights up even the murkiest of mysteries.*

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Turn to the wisdom of a drow. Once of Lothe, then of Shar.

117.speaker: Narrator
117.text: *Experience fills you - a lifetime in service of darkenss. Yet, most curious - there is light there also. Adventures, long past. Friends and companions, remembered with a secret fondness.*

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Warm to the guile of a bard who could charm even a dragon.

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *Adoring looks, fawning laughter and nods of agreement are your constant companions. Is there anything a quick tongue and a warm smile cannot achieve...?*

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *It seems to be intrigued by you.*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *A foreign sensation assails you. For a moment, you do not feel like yourself.*

114.speaker: Narrator
114.text: *Disappointment floods your mind. You were sure to succeed Stelmane, but Lord Enver Gortash has stolen your support. All that charming and cajoling in the parlours of the Upper City, wasted.*

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *You embody Arves, the merchant you met, deep in mourning. His wife died, and he cannot bear to go on. Only the House of Grief can help him.*

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *Whatever power lurks deeper in the recesses of the mirror has no interest in you.*

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *You embody a merchant, deep in mourning. His wife died, and he cannot bear to go on. Only the House of Grief can help him.*

96.speaker: Narrator
96.text: *You embody a heartbroken heiress, desperate to forget an unrequited love. The sadness flees from you... along with a string of numbers. A safe combination?*

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *Your mind is that of corrupt alderman, eager to forget his transgressions. You feel them fade away... but your faith in the goddess Selûne is devoured along with them.*

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *You embody an officer of the City Watch. A comrade died because of you. The dead man's face fades away... but the identities of informants vanish as well.*

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *A jumble of memories clamour for your attention. They range from ancient to new. But none are yours.*

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Your little hideaway in the cloister. It helped you weather life's blows. Give up that sense of solace.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: You fled the city watch once, leaving graffiti in your wake. Let go of that memory of youthful speed and nimbleness.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: You will not surrender any part of yourself. Invent a false offering to trick the mirror.

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *To your surprise, the false memory is accepted. It fades from your mind as easily as it was conjured forth.*

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *Your deception fails. You sense the mirror would snatch something true from you, but you have nothing it desires.*

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *The deception fails. You feel that something true to you is wrested from you as punishment, with nothing given in return.*

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Study the mirror. Try to grasp its true nature.

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *A Mirror of Loss - a relic said to be as old as the Church of Shar itself. Those who stood before it could surrender their very thoughts and memories to the Lady of Loss.*

20.speaker: Narrator
20.text: *Great powers rest within the realm of the mirror, to be granted at the Dark Lady's whim to those making a suitable offering - a piece of themselves.*

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *Nothing comes to you. The mirror remains a mystery.*

76.speaker: Player
76.text: An object of faith. Examine it closely. Try to understand its purpose.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Offer a prayer to the mirror.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Offer a prayer to the mirror.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Offer a prayer to the mirror.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Offer a prayer to the mirror.

113.speaker: Narrator
113.text: *You feel a presence; dark and ancient. It approves of your fealty.*

108.speaker: Narrator
108.text: *Your prayers fade away into the nothingness of the mirror, unacknowledged.*

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *A great, dark mirror looms over you, offering no reflection. You do not know its purpose... yet it feels oddly familiar to you, all the same.*

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *A huge, polished disc looms before you. A mirror - one used by the Sharrans to plunder memories from the minds of others.*

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *A huge, polished disc looms before you. A mirror - but one that offers no reflection. All you see in it is a void of endless darkness.*

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *A huge, polished disc looms before you. A mirror - one that was used to wrest your memories from you.*
